New Records: Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit the game-winning infield single in the 11th inning of the Yankees’ 4-3 win over the Royals
Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit the game-winning infield single in the 11th inning
Juan Soto homered after fouling the ball hard off his foot
Luke Weaver held down the Kansas City offense in the top of the 11th
Clay Holmes allowed a game-tying run in the seventh inning
A wild pitch from Jake Cousins gave the Royals a brief lead in the 10th
Austin Wells lofted a fly ball down the left-field line that just traveled far enough to score Anthony Volpe from third
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees did not reach second base Tuesday and did not take an at-bat with a runner in scoring position until the seventh inning Wednesday
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Aaron Boone said the win was a really good one and that the bullpen was excellent
Jazz Chisholm Jr. described himself as wide-eyed after the game-winning hit
Aaron Boone said the series win was big for the team
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees moved 1 ½ games clear of the Orioles in the AL East
The game was played in front of 40,908 in The Bronx
This was the Yankees' third walk-off of the year
Others: The Yankees' bullpen is being reimagined with Luke Weaver and Jake Cousins at the back
Gleyber Torres walked in the sixth inning before Juan Soto fouled a pitch off the top of his right, front foot
